content.body: GPHemsley: Seems to be working per-spec? the inherited font-weight is 400 (not bold), and lighter is relative to the inherited font weight
content.formatted_body: GPHemsley: Seems to be working per-spec? the inherited font-weight is 400 (not bold), and lighter is relative to the inherited font weight

content.body: the bold comes from the user agent stylesheet, it's not inherited from anywhere, it's literally a rule saying `h1, th { font-weight: bold }`
content.formatted_body: the bold comes from the user agent stylesheet, it's not inherited from anywhere, it's literally a rule saying h1, th { font-weight: bold }

content.body:
think of it like having this CSS:

```
.target { font-weight: bold } // browser user agent stylesheet
.target { font-weight: lighter } // your style
```
content.formatted_body:
think of it like having this CSS:

.target { font-weight: bold } // browser user agent stylesheet
.target { font-weight: lighter } // your style

content.body: first rule gets overridden by the second one
so it acts as if font-weight: bold never existed (which is how overriding works)
